channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Bombogenesis! Eastern U.S. Braces for Blizzard Conditions
item.description: A bomb cyclone could dump 1 to 2 feet of snow on the upper Great Lakes, per the National Weather Service.

item.title: How to tweak your online platform algorithms
item.description: Love them or hate them, more than half of the world's population interacts with algorithmic recommendations in some way every day. Algorithmic recommendations play an integral role in how users discover new content across platforms like Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube. It can be nice to be fed a stream of fresh posts, pictures, and […]

item.title: Pourquoi un iPhone sans batterie pourrait bientôt ouvrir une Tesla
item.description: Des lignes de code dénichées dans la dernière mise à jour de l'application Tesla suggèrent l'arrivée imminente d'une vraie clé numérique native. De quoi rattraper un retard technologique agaçant face à la concurrence.

item.title: Software supply chain attacks pose huge dangers - here's how to bolster your defenses
item.description: A new report shows how risky software supply chains really are, and how AI only makes it worse.

item.title: Free met en place un dispositif spécial pour ne pas perdre le réseau au nouvel an
item.description: Pour assurer une disponibilité de son réseau mobile face à l'affluence attendue le 31 décembre, Free Mobile a mis une installation spéciale sur les Champs-Élysées à Paris.

item.title: A Deadly Mad Cow-Like Disease Is Spreading Among North American Deer
item.description: Wildlife officials in the U.S. and Canada report cases of chronic wasting diseases where it hasn't been detected before.

item.title: Transports en Ile-de-France : 2026 signe la fin définitive du ticket en carton
item.description: 2026 sera une année charnière pour les transports publics en Ile-de-France. Le bon vieux ticket en carton va définitivement disparaître, tandis qu'il sera possible d'acheter et de stocker des titres dans Google Wallet sur Android, comme sur l'iPhone avec l'app Cartes d'Apple. Enfin !

item.title: CES 2026: What to expect from tech’s biggest conference in January
item.description: CES is the January trade show where the tech industry kicks off the year with a bevy of new and notable announcements — and it’s less than a week away. The CES 2026 show floor is officially open from January 6 through 9, but the fun kicks off with events on Sunday January 4 and a host of press conferences on Monday. As always, product demos, announcements and networking will be happening at the Las Vegas Convention Center and other hotels all over the city. As usual, Engadget will be covering the event in-person and remotely, bringing you news and hands-ons straight from the show floor.More sp...

item.title: Test du Clam ACE 2 : de vraies qualités, une signature sonore ajustable
item.description: Fresh 'n Rebel n'est pas le premier nom qui vient à l'esprit quand on parle de casques audio. Pourtant, avec son Clam ACE 2 à 99 euros, la marque néerlandaise prouve qu'il est possible de proposer un casque circum-auriculaire avec ANC, Bluetooth multipoint et finitions léchées sans exploser son budget. Alors, miracle économique ou compromis douloureux ? On a testé. ...

item.title: Fini le tout tactile ? Ce smartphone coulissant cache une vraie manette (ou presque)
item.description: Quinze ans après, le concept du téléphone-console fait son grand retour. L'AYANEO Pocket PLAY ne se contente pas de jouer sur la nostalgie : il promet un affichage OLED ultra-rapide et une vraie manette coulissante pour séduire les gamers.

item.title: Beats’ new Powerbeats Fit earbuds are down to $180
item.description: It’s almost the new year and time to treat yourself to a new pair of earbuds — especially if one of your resolutions for 2026 is to work out more. If you find yourself reading this and nodding, take a look at the Beats Powerbeats Fit, a recent upgrade of Beats’ Fit Pro earbuds that […]

item.title: How to use the new ChatGPT app integrations, including DoorDash, Spotify, Uber, and others
item.description: Learn how to use Spotify, Canva, Figma, Expedia, and other apps directly in ChatGPT.

item.title: Tout simplement son prix le plus bas sur Amazon : l’iPhone Air 256 Go, le plus fin des iPhone, perd 150 €
item.description: L'iPhone Air est le successeur de l'iPhone SE, un smartphone ultrafin et léger que vous retrouvez à son prix le plus bas sur Amazon, soit 1 079 euros au lieu de 1 229 euros.

item.title: Bigger batteries, better AI, and more: here’s what the TechRadar team wants to see from smartphones in 2026
item.description: Here’s what our resident tech-heads are hoping for in the world of smartphones next year.

item.title: Robots in 2026 — the rise of Terminator this is not
item.description: 2026 should be a big year in robotics with humanoid robots in the home and in factories, but it also won't be as transformative as some think.

item.title: Le jeu illimité sur GeForce Now, c’est terminé : Nvidia impose un plafond à tout le monde… ou presque
item.description: Nvidia met en place ce que la firme annonçait l'an dernier : une limite de temps de jeu mensuel via son service de cloud gaming GeForce Now. Tout le monde est concerné, sauf certains abonnés.

item.title: Rainbow Six Siege servers are back online after shutting down in response to Marketplace hacks
item.description: Ubisoft had to shut down Rainbow Six Siege's servers and roll back transactions, a situation that came from a widespread breach that left various players with billions of in-game credits, ultra-rare skins of weapons, and banned accounts. As of Sunday, December 28, the status page on Rainbow Six Siege's website still shows "unplanned outage" on all servers across PC, PlayStation and Xbox.Later that evening, though, the company confirmed that it was done testing on the update it pushed out and was opening the severs back up to players. It also said that the transaction rollback was complete, but...

item.title: ‘The X-Files’ Is Ready to Be Your Free Streaming Binge for the New Year
item.description: Every episode from the classic run and the 2016 revival is coming to Pluto TV on January 1.

item.title: Google Photos s’invite sur les téléviseurs de Samsung, mais snobe toujours Google TV
item.description: Absent de manière assez paradoxale sur Google TV, Google Photos s’invite enfin sur les écrans du salon… mais par une porte dérobée. Samsung annonce l’arrivée progressive de fonctions issues du service de stockage et de partage de photos de Google sur ses téléviseurs connectés, avec des diaporamas intelligents et des thèmes générés par IA dès 2026 — sans pour autant proposer, pour l’instant, l’application complète....

item.title: The 32 top enterprise tech startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.description: Here is the full list of the enterprise tech Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: How to keep your kids safe in this AI-powered world
item.description: AI is suddenly everywhere in children’s lives. In their games, homework and chats. Here’s how parents can move past fear and feel confident about keeping them safe.

item.title: I asked ChatGPT for my New Year's resolutions, and now I feel almost too seen
item.description: ChatGPT proves surprisingly adept at coming up with meaningful New Year's resolutions — use this prompt to get yours

item.title: Polarsteps is the free app that tracks your travels — and it just made my New Year’s resolutions list
item.description: Polarsteps is a completely free app that allows you to track and share your travels and journeys, and it even offers a Spotify Wrapped-style recap.

item.title: I didn’t quit social media in 2025, but I might have to if this awful trend continues in 2026
item.description: Instagram is becoming a dumping ground for AI slop, and it now seems to be coming from Meta itself.

item.title: NYT Connections hints and answers for Tuesday, December 30 (game #933)
item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.title: Quordle hints and answers for Tuesday, December 30 (game #1436)
item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: NYT Strands hints and answers for Tuesday, December 30 (game #667)
item.description: Looking for NYT Strands answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, including the spangram.

item.title: The new ROI: Return on inclusion
item.description: Accessibility is no longer just compliance. For years, accessibility was treated as a compliance exercise, something required rather than desired. Yet in today’s consumer landscape, where aging, chronic illness, and situational disability touch every household, accessibility is no longer a specialty category. It is one of the biggest growth opportunities in business. Companies that recognize this shift are discovering a new kind of ROI. It is not return on investment alone. It is return on inclusion....

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, 1960s French screen siren turned activist, dies at 91
item.description: Bruno Jacquelin, of the Brigitte Bardot Foundation, did not give a cause of death. Brigitte Bardot, the French 1960s sex symbol who became one of the greatest screen sirens of the 20th century and later a militant animal rights activist and far-right supporter, has died. She was 91.Bardot died Sunday at her home in southern France, according to Bruno Jacquelin, of the Brigitte Bardot Foundation for the protection of animals. Speaking to The Associated Press, he gave no cause of death, and said that no arrangements had been made for funeral or memorial services. She had been hospitalized last m...

item.title: This experimental camera can focus on everything at once
item.description: A camera lens, historically, can only focus on one thing at a time, just like the human eye. That could be a thing of the past, though, thanks to a breakthrough lens technology developed by researchers at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) that can bring every part of a scene into sharp focus, capturing finer details […]

item.title: Pénurie de RAM : on sait pourquoi les cartes graphiques n’ont pas (encore) augmenté de prix
item.description: Les cartes graphiques ont été jusqu'à maintenant relativement protégées de la pénurie de DRAM qui touche tout le marché de l'informatique. Mais des hausses de prix seraient à prévoir dès le mois prochain.

item.title: « Impossible de dire si c’est un humain » : un expert de Nvidia bluffé après avoir testé la conduite autonome de Tesla
item.description: Spécialiste de la robotique, un cadre de Nvidia a tester la dernière version de la conduite autonome de Tesla. Et on peut dire que l’expérience a été particulièrement concluante pour cet expert, qui ne cache pas son admiration.
